summary:
Lactic acid is a type of organic acid found in many places in nature. It's made up of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms. This acid is used in various industries, like making medicine and food. Lactic acid can be produced by bacteria or made artificially. Interestingly, it comes in two forms that are like mirror images, called enantiomers.

In our bodies, lactic acid is created when there's not enough oxygen during exercise or in certain medical conditions. It can also be used in medical solutions to help with blood loss.
title: Lactic acid
